data.title: The Eargo 6 is a virtually invisible hearing aid with new Sound Adjust technology
data.description: Hearing aids have traditionally gotten a bad rap: clunky, tinny, inconvenient and expensive. As a result, millions of Americans who suffer from hearing loss have come to expect a poor hearing aid experience as par for the course.

data.title: How technology is helping improve financial inclusion around the world
data.description: "There's this new type of excitement about putting your money to work for you," said Flori Marquez, the founder of BlockFi, a cryptocurrency trading platform.

data.title: U.S. Energy Secretary Granholm calls on oil and gas companies to raise output
data.description: Fuel prices are at record highs. The Department of Energy calls on companies to start drilling. The message is at odds with a prior focus on green technologies.

data.title: A rare bright spot in the stock market may be set to fizzle out
data.description: Tech stocks, like the rest of the broader market, have seen their fair share of ups and downs since Russia's invasion of Ukraine at the end of February. But for one part of the technology sector — cybersecurity -— it's been a roaring bull market for the past few weeks.

data.title: Cathie Wood says she still expects to see 'spectacular returns' over the next 5 years
data.description: "Given our expectations for growth in these new technologies, I think we're going to see some spectacular returns," the Ark Invest CEO told CNBC's "Capital Connection."

data.title: How the war in Ukraine and climate change are shaping the nuclear industry
data.description: Russia and China have dominated nuclear power for decades, but the United States may have an opening due to the recent Ukraine war and new nuclear technology.

data.title: Apple and FBI grilled by lawmakers on spyware from Israeli NSO Group
data.description: The letters come after The New York Times reported earlier this year that the FBI had acquired surveillance technology from the NSO Group.
